headline: Original Nestle Toll House Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: The original Toll House cookie recipe has been used for generations. These sweet, chewy cookies are a true American treat no matter what the occasion.

video.name: How to Make Original Nestle Toll House Chocolate Chip Cookies

name: Original Nestle Toll House Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipeIngredient: 2 cups semisweet chocolate chips (such as Nestl√© Toll House)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Combine flour, baking soda and salt in small bowl.

Beat butter, white sugar, brown sugar and vanilla in a large mixing bowl until creamy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Gradually beat in flour mixture. Stir in chocolate morsels and nuts.
Drop by rounded tablespoon onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 9 to 11 minutes, switching racks halfway through.
Cool on the baking sheets for 2 minutes, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.

review.reviewBody: I made them according to recipe but added 1 tsp extra vanilla. They turned out perfect. I have a gas oven and I cooked them at 365¬∞ for 8 minutes. They were perfect size and taste wonderful. My grand kids love them. This will be the recipe I use for chocolate chip cookies.
the best cookies in the world.

These were very good. Maybe not the best cookie I've ever eaten but definitely worth making again. I used room temp. eggs and butter. Also used Ghirardelli dark choc. chips and pecans. They were a little crispy around the edges and chewy in the middle. If I could I would give it 4-1/2 stars.
The cookies turned out excellent i did brown half of the butter though which really sets off the flavor.
Just omitted the nuts because I don't like them .üëãüèªüíûüåªüç™üòéü§îü¶Ñü¶öüá∫üá¶
awesome i found this exiting.

I have used this recipe for over 40 years with one slight difference. The recipe I copied from the back of a pack of Nestle chips called for 1 tsp water. So I always add that. I have also used this recipe replacing chocolate chips with m&ms, gum drops, butterscotch chips, white chips, peppermint chips, or anything I think of. They have always come out perfect. This is the best recipe ever!!!!!
You have to really cream together butter sugar eggs and vanilla whip them for about a minute to make fluffy. I do this with a stand mixer in high . This makes a big difference in my cookies.

Came out looking like super thin brown pancakes. Way to wet. I can't believe anyone had a good result with this recipe. Waisted time and ingredients. The worst recipe I have ever used for anything I have ever made.
Tasted just like Grandma used to make. Brought back many happy days that I would spend at my grandma's and help her make her chocolate chip cookies

This is the best recipe for good cookies in general. I took a caramel,pretzel and milk chocolate bar from Trader Joe's and cut it into pieces and chunks. Plus milk chocolate chips. Of course I added walnuts. They came out better than I expected. Delicious and very soft.
I used the recipe and made a cookie cake for my sons birthday, everyone loved it and I‚Äôll be making it again. I did add in some peanut butter candies instead of nuts.
Perfect recipe and super easy.
Perfect ‚ù§Ô∏è
My Family's Favorite Chocolate chip cookies .

Exactly as expected. For those experiencing spreading issues, use room temp (not melted) butter and mix the butter for a couple of minutes until light and fluffy, add the sugar and, again, beat for 2 - 3 minutes until light and fluffy, mix in eggs and vanilla (I did double the vanilla, but that is personal taste) until fully incorporated. Now put away your mixer! Many measuring cups lie to you, so if at all possible weigh your flour - All Purpose Flour weighs 4.2 oz or 120g per cup ... or 270g for this recipe's call of 2 1/4 cups of AP flour. Add all of your dry ingredients and hand mix. Scoop with a #30 disher ( 1 oz, black handle) and bake in a well-preheated 375¬∞ oven for 11 minutes. I got 34 cookies.
I love this recipe!!perfect cookies !!

Toll House is a great stand by for a basic cookie. I add 1/4 c. regular whole oats, (less 1/4 c. flour) chopped mixed nuts, raisins & dried cranberries. I often add chop some crystalized ginger. I omitted 1/4c. regular white sugar and added 1/4 c. real maple sugar (for extra flavor). Always put cookie dough in the fridg. I like to make cookie dough rolls and cut/bake as needed. Do not thaw more than 1/2 hour on counter, cut while still very firm. Then I have fresh cookies anytime.

Absolutely fantastic recipe for a stunning first time 5 star success. I remember failing with this old recipe many years ago, but I've learned a few tricks in the past 50 years about consistency and quality in cooking. Firstly, I use a high quality all purpose flour with a proven track record. It costs more than 3 times ordinary all purpose flour (and doesn't retard or kill my pet sourdough starter--a good clue that it's better for you too!) I also weigh my flour to the gram, avoiding wide variations in the compaction and amount of flour that would occur by scooping it. These two simple tricks that I don't even think about yielded perfection in this recipe. Very high rise, thick and moist goodness! No alterations required! These were better than grandma's!

the only change i made was add a tbsp of disaronna[almond flavored liquer],an extra quarter cup of chips and only made 24 big cookies ,cooked them for 7 minutes turned the pan and another 7 minutes. after out slam the the pan and cool them for a minute before transferring to a wire rack to cool for 5 minutes
I absolutely love this recipe.

Holy Moly...DELICIOUS isn't even good enough...scrumptious and very ADDICTIVE..mmm mmmm yummy with a glass of ice cold milk or Nestles Quick chocolate milk!!!!!!! I added an extra handful of chopped walnuts. I do share with very special well deserving people... my friend eats his with a couple tablespoons of vanilla ice cream between two cookies I'll have to try that haven't tried it yet..... I've been loving these Nestle house cookies for as long as I can remember. Thank you Nesle

Just made a batch to which I added freeze-dried (*not* rehydrated), sliced strawberries (in place of the nuts that I never add). O! M!! G!!! Just made another batch, this one with the zest of an entire large orange. Really tasty, and the smell during baking is heavenly!
The exact recipe, for those times when you want the cookie but not the Nestle chocolate chips.
This has been the recipe I have used for years
The Best!
Very pretty and delicious.
Yes I put cherry chips in instead of chocolate

After reading reviews which was a little mixed I made jumbo cookies 14 of them 
I used an ice cream scoop then popped them into the fridge for 30 minutes.
I used 1/2 bicarb and 1/2 baking powder
Threw in couple table spoons of flour as I omitted nuts. Next time I will use just 1 table spoon of extra flour cooked 15 minutes 
Didn‚Äôt spread too much. Texture was to my liking crisp outside chewy in the middle.
this is hubby's favorite cookie. If i make a different recipe, or chip, he knows. and won't eat the cookies !!
Family loved them! Made recipe as is.
yummmmmmmy
best cookies I have ever made
I always do 1/2 cup white sugar and 1 cup brown sugar.

I‚Äôve been making these for years and have a few tips for those who struggle with getting the cookies not to spread/flatten or who want a nice presentation. First use butter and eggs at room temperature. Second, do not over-mix the wet ingredients or when adding the dry ingredients. I usually add the dry in three parts, only mixing (with dough hooks) until it‚Äôs slightly incorporated. When I add chocolate chips at the end, I make sure it‚Äôs all incorporated. Third, do a test run. If the test cookies flatten regardless, use a cookie scoop to shape them and place on a cookie sheet in the freezer. Once they harden, place them in the oven frozen. It will help them maintain their shape. I also pull mine out about a minute before they are done since they will cook a bit on the tray. You can also freeze the dough into shape and place in an airtight container in the freezer for up to three months. Just pull a couple out when you want some cookies or bake when you have company.
My family and friends LOVE these! I always make them when we have gatherings cause they request them and their always gone! My niece calls me the master cookie maker! I definitely recommend these!

I like a "flat" chewy chocolate chip cookie, and bars. When the bars come out of the oven the first thing I do is drop the pan from about a foot up onto a towel placed on my counter. This knocks them down. On the cookies I will leave out a egg if they are fluffy. I will add 2 table spoons of water to make up for moisture the egg would have added. and always add either walnuts or pecans. and split chips using half milk chocolate chips. I almost always go with making bars these days, easier to control texture and much faster with less heat in the kitchen from opening oven doors.

I disagree with allot of the reviews recommending a boat load of tweaks.....main thing to do differently is chill your dough fully. 

Make the dough atleast the day before baking so it will be properly chilled with fats solidified, that way the fat takes longer to melt and your cookie won't spread so much. I store mine flat and cut them into cubes. Easy. Also remember if you omit nuts the original recipe itself calls for more flour (I use chopped pecans).

Sometimes I put some extra chips on top the cookie before baking for looks but it's not necessary.... I follow the recipe, my eggs are still chilled, I use an electric hand mixer. I don't use bread flour or extra this and that. Cookies still come out great, classic and are always a crowd pleaser. Definitely if you want to alter it then go for it but it's not absolutely necessary.
I don‚Äôt know what I‚Äôm doing wrong but the texture comes out cake like (like lady fingers)
Cookies are very good but if using salted butter I would reduce the amount of salt.
Perfect cookies. Always cream the butter and sugar.
Took out the nuts so it's basically chocolate chip cookies

DO NOT USE THIS RECIPE. IT IS NOT THE ORIGINAL TOLLHOUSE RECIPE. SOMEWHERE ALONG THE LINE THEY ADDED TOO MUCH SUGAR AND TOO LITTLE FLOUR AND EVERYONE IS SAYING WHAT I AM SAYING THAT CONSEQUENTLY THESE COOKIES COOK UP FLAT. I have only ever used the tollhouse recipe since I was a child, and when I was a child, I simply dumped the ingredients in one bowl without thinking about it. Now no matter what stove I use the dough cooks flat. Somewhere along the way, Tollhouse added sugar to their recipe to make it sweeter and for whatever reason took out the flour. Compare this recipe to other recipes on the web and you will see the same issue.

Made them as directed it‚Äôs the exact recipe I‚Äôve been making for years I‚Äôve read several peoples comments about the cookies spreading one of the best tips I can give you is not worrying about chilling the dough but using a scoop in scooping out your cookie dough onto your pan.You end up with a nice sized gooey chocolate cookie.

I always loved these cookies when my Mom made them, but then when I started making my own mine were BETTER? Through a series of trial and error I discovered the difference--my Mom made hers with pre-chopped walnuts and I make mine with whole walnuts that I chop myself. I don't know enough about the chemistry of baking to understand why it works this way--but if you include the nut meal you get after chopping the nuts, it give the recipe . . . something. Just thought y'all would enjoy that tip!
Followed the directions until the amount of chips. Added about 2.25 cups of Chocolate Chips. Perfect!

Always the best, but a 1/2 butter-1/2 margarine makes them not come out flat. My grandson loves Toll House cookies, and they are quick and easy to make. ( I always make sure I have a well-stocked pantry with ALL my baking needs!)

Mine turned out nice and fluffy (not flat at all) once I made a little change. 375 was too high. Not sure if it‚Äôs my oven, but when I put the second tray in at 350 for 14 minutes they were perfect. 9 minutes on 375 got me a tray of burned on the bottom cookies

I've been making these cookies since I was a little girl. A lot of reviewers talked about how spread out they become. I don't know if there is science behind this, but I find my cookie shape is dictated by the weather.
Love this recipe. The only thing I do differently is use 1/2 c of shortening and 1/2 c of butter; instead of 1 cup butter.

Too funny - I was half done and reached for the flour - whoops - I was 1 cup short.
So I looked for a substitute. I grabbed a cake mix, shook the bag gently to make the heavier ingredients drop to the bottom and I scooped 1 cup from the top. 
Sifted it down to some lumpy left in the bottom(dumped that).
Worked great - hubby said they were "really good". 
I might run out of flour next time!
Very easy to follow
Came out great. Added some shredded coconut instead of nuts and tastes good. Thank you for sharing this
No changes made, all gone by 8 pm.
great!
I needed to bake them for only 8 minutes or they burnt. Could just be my oven. I also may try less white sugar next time. But of course, yummy.
I followed this recipe and the cookies looked awful. I questioned having the oven to 375¬∞, I should of went with my gut. They were burnt before 8 minutes of baking.
Love em!
Delish!!!

The first time I made the receipe as written with the exception of using 1/2 cup crisco in place of half the butter. I also ground soft white wheat for the flour. They were good, but too flat and sugary. The second time, I used the high altitude version, with added flour and reduced sugar, same crisco/butter combo, same fresh-milled flour. (We are at 1700 ft.) These are sensational. I keep them in the freezer and my husband eats them cold. He and the neighbors rave about them.
Thank you for having this recipe on here. The bag of chocolate chips didn't have the original recipe on it, but had n oatmeal chocolate chip one. The cookies turned out great!
Great! There really good. Funny to make with family!
Excellant everyone loved them
i added walnuts and coconut and decreased the amount of sugar. freezing the dough worked great
Recipe is good. It will spread and be thinner. I skip the nuts and I change the chocolate to butterscotch chips.

MOST HELPFUL (others too much talk).
Bottom line...eggs and butter at room temperature! DONT OVERMIX!!! Just until blended. Soft in center and crispy edges. Also if heating element on bottom of oven put rack in middle. No need to refrigerate or add extra flour.perfect every time.
Best chocolate chip cookies...ever!
The only change I made, was to omit the nuts. Excellent recipe!
Added a little more flour and some extra chips! Perfect!!

This is a bad recipe. I made it once and my cookies came out flat. I was convinced I just not have paid attention to measuring. I made it again today and same result. My measuring was fine. They are thin and crack into many pieces. It was a waste of ingredients. The balance of sugar to flour is wrong.
Perfect Chocolate Chip Cookies every time! Don‚Äôt over bake!
I didn't make any changes but it did taste a little powdery or something, I would suggest cooking for a little longer like 13 minutes.

Chef Joy hit it on the head! I've been making these cookies since I was a kid with Mom (50 years ago) and today I got lazy and used my mixer to blend the ingredients. I did everything the same as always but my cookies were as flat and thin as crepes! They're still killer delicious, but I'll never use the mixer again. Old school still rules!
The cookies tasted sooooo good thank you for the recipes.
I did not add the nuts and yes, I will use this recipe again. Cookies were moist and chewy with a slight crunch around the edges; just the way my family likes them.
Mmmm yum loved them
Too much flour made the cookies like cake
Makes the best chocolate chip cookies EVER
Not the best I have had but probably because I used sugar free chips, however the cookie was a bit cake like, not how I remember them being.

I normally make the store bought kind, but this was such an easy recipe to follow that I decided to give them a try. My husband loved the walnuts in them! They were crispy and chewy at the same time. Delicious! This will be my go to recipe from now on.

I normally make the store bought kind, but this was such an easy recipe to follow that I decided to give them a try. My husband loved the walnuts in them! They were crispy and chewy at the same time. Delicious! This will be my go to recipe from now on.
I tasted really good but they were very brittle.
I added 2 teaspoons of espresso instant coffee to the recipe.
Perfect cookies! Soft and chewy!
I added a quarter cup of additional flour and used 2 teaspoons of vanilla bean paste instead of 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract and they were fluffier and lighter. So delicious!
These are great but I would add double nuts. I made using splenda and splenda brown sugar. The cookies do not flatten out like normal cookies but the taste is really good.
Quite good!

I make this in the pan cookie form but in a 9x13 pan. They are a hit everywhere I take them. People think it‚Äôs a special recipe and are always shocked when I tell them it‚Äôs the Toll House cookie recipe in bar form. An entire batch disappears in the blink of an eye. It is seriously a guaranteed hit with children and adults!
We used all brown sugar, not white for a fluffier texture
Perfect

Followed exactly (ish), and added a simple chocolate drizzle after. It‚Äôs a winner every time. Be mindful how long you cook them! They can become crisp pretty quick! For my oven and low elevation, the recommended time by the recipe is correct.
I used Heath Bar pieces but with the measurement for the chocolate chip version - the Heath version uses less but it's just as good with more like the chocolate chips. Delicious!
I did not use nuts
Great! Tweaking some things it tastes just like Grandma's
Followed the recipe and these were very good!!
Followed the recipe and these were very good!!
I did add a few more chips to my cookies. When I store them, I put a piece of bread under the wax paper to keep them soft. I prefer soft and chewy to crisp cookies. This works!

Absoluuthe best recipe! Tasted just like the ones I buy in the store. Followed the recipe exact!! Made so many cookies I had them for a month. (We eat cookies everyday) I made my slice and bakes kind of thick so I was able to get about 60 cookies out of it
